post.author: 이진경
post.content:
lang=EN-US style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Three women in North Florida, turned
up at hospitals over a 5-day period, all with the same symptoms. Fever, chills,
and vomiting, followed by muscular collapse, paralysis, and finally, death.
There were no outward signs of trauma. Autopsy results showed toxicity in the
blood.style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> lang=EN-US style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">These
women did not know each other, and seemed to have nothing in common. It was
discovered, however, that they had all visited the same Restaurant (Olive
Garden) within days of their deaths. The health department descended on the
restaurant, shutting it down. The food, water, and air conditioning were all
inspected and tested, to no avail.color=black>
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The
big break came when a waitress at the restaurant was rushed to the hospital with
similar symptoms. She told doctors that she had been on vacation, and had only
went to the restaurant to pick up her check.color=black>

style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">She did not eat or
drink while she was there, but had used the restroom.face=Arial color=black>style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">
color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">That is when one
toxicologist, remembering an article he had read, drove out to the restaurant,
went into the restroom, and lifted the toilet seat.face=Arial color=black>style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> lang=EN-US style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Under
the seat, out of normal view, was a small spider. The spider was captured and
brought back to the lab, where it was determined to be the Two-Striped Telamonia
(Telamonia dimidiata), so named because of its reddened flesh color. This
spider's venom is extremely toxic, but can take several days to take effect..
They live in cold, dark, damp climates, and toilet rims provide just the right
atmosphere.style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> lang=EN-US style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Several
days later a lawyer from face=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Jacksonvilleface=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> showed up at a
hospital emergency room. Before his death, he told the doctor, that he had been
away on business, had taken a flight from
color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Indonesiaface=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, changing planes in
color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Singaporeface=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, before returning
home. He did not visit (Olive Garden), while there. He did, as did all of the
other victims, have what was determined to be a puncture wound, on his right
buttock.style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> lang=EN-US style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Investigators
discovered that the flight he was on had originated in
color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Indiaface=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">. The Civilian
Aeronautics Board (CAB) ordered an immediate inspection of the toilets of all
flights from face=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Indiaface=Arial color=navy>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">, and discovered the
Two-Striped Telamonia (Telamonia dimidiata) spider's nests on 4 different
planes!style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"> lang=EN-US style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: navy; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">It
is now believed that these spiders can be anywhere in the country.
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: red; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">So please, before you
use a public toilet, lift the seat to check for spiders. It can save your
life!style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">
color=red>style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: red; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">And please pass this
on to everyone you care about.color=black>
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial">


style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; COLOR: black">src="http://habitatnews.nus.edu.sg/guidebooks/spiders/pics/1132.jpg" width=119
NOSEND="1">style="mso-spacerun: yes"> style="COLOR: navy">
post.title: NEWS ABOUT A DEADLY Spider
